{{cpp/ranges/subrange/title|size}}
{{cpp/ranges/subrange/navbar}}
{{ddcl|since=c++20|1=
constexpr /*make-unsigned-like-t*/&lt;std::iter_difference_t&lt;I&gt;&gt; size() const
    requires (K == ranges::subrange_kind::sized);
}}

Obtains the number of elements in the {{rlpt|/|subrange}}:
* If {{box|{{rlpsi|/#StoreSize}}}} is {{c|true}}, returns {{box|{{rlpsi|/#size_}}}}.
* Otherwise, returns {{box|{{lsi|cpp/ranges#to-unsigned-like}}{{sep}}{{c/core|(}}{{rlpsi|/#end_}}{{nbspt}}{{c/core|-}}{{nbspt}}{{rlpsi|/#begin_}}{{sep}}{{c/core|)}}}}.

For the definition of {{c/core|/*make-unsigned-like-t*/}}, see {{lsi|cpp/ranges#make-unsigned-like-t}}{{sep}}.

===Return value===
As described above.

===Example===
{{example
|code=
#include &lt;functional&gt;
#include &lt;iostream&gt;
#include &lt;ranges&gt;
#include &lt;utility&gt;

int main()
{
    const auto v = {2, 2, 2, 7, 1, 1, 1, 1, 8, 2, 2, 2, 2, 2};
    
    // the value type of views::chunk_by is the ranges::subrange
    
    auto to_pair = [](auto sub) { return std::make_pair(sub[0], sub.size()); };
                                                                 /* ^^^^ */
    auto pairs = v {{!}} std::views::chunk_by(std::equal_to{})
                   {{!}} std::views::transform(to_pair);
    
    for (auto x : pairs bitor std::views::keys)
        std::cout &lt;&lt; x &lt;&lt; ' ';
    std::cout &lt;&lt; '\n';
    for (auto x : pairs bitor std::views::values)
        std::cout &lt;&lt; x &lt;&lt; ' ';
    std::cout &lt;&lt; '\n';
}
|output=
2 7 1 8 2
3 1 4 1 5
}}
